name: 1.9: "Coach Returns to Action" Quiz | Television | 10 Questions

questions.text: In the cold opening, what did the tour guide tell the tourists that Cheers was?
questions.explanation:
Paul Revere's house.

	Sam questioned the man and he told him that it was freezing outside. When Sam told him that Paul Revere's house was no where near where they were the man replied, "Do you wanna do this?"

questions.text: When Sam asked Norm, "What's up Norm?", how did Norm reply?
questions.explanation:
"My nipples, it's freezing out there."

	Norm always had such great replies when they asked him how he was doing. Norm was a regular at Cheers even before Sam was the owner.

questions.text: Cliff explained why you would drink ice cold beer on a cold day. Why did he say you drink it on a hot day?
questions.correct: "What else you gonna do with it?"
questions.explanation:
"What else you gonna do with it?".

	Cliff Clavin was always filled with fascinating facts. Often the facts weren't very factual but he was considered the bar know-it-all. John Ratzenberger, who played Cliff, created the role. He initially tried out for the part of Norm but when he didn't get the part he asked the producers and director if they had a bar know-it-all because all bars have one. And so, Cliff Clavin was born. In the first season he was not listed as a regular cast member.

questions.text: What did Coach think he had?
questions.explanation:
Malaria.

	Coach forgot to wear his coat and it was only 30 degrees outside. Coach was often rather dimwitted but the other people at Cheers did not seem to mind this. Everyone loved Coach.

questions.text: What was the name of the woman Coach was interested in?
questions.explanation:
Nina.

	Nina was played by Murphy Cross. Cross was born on June 22, 1950 in Maryland. She was one of the Boylan sisters in "Annie", the 1982 version.

questions.text: What kind of gas did Coach say they used to pressurize the beer kegs?
questions.explanation:
unleaded.

	Coach didn't know the answer so he guessed the only gas he was familiar with. Nina didn't seem to mind Coach's simpleness.

questions.text: How long did Coach say Carla had been in a lousy mood for?
questions.explanation:
2-3 years.

	Coach asked Carla to come over and she snapped at him, saying, "I'm busy." Carla was a very feisty woman and often snapped at people.

questions.text: Was the woman that Coach liked interested in Sam?
questions.explanation:
No.

	Sam was a bit of a wolf when it came to women. Nina, however, was not interested in Sam. Sam thought it was a friend of Diane's who set him up to look like a fool.

questions.text: How did Coach get women's attention during his baseball days?
questions.explanation:
injured himself.

	Coach said if he liked a girl he would throw himself down a flight of stairs. He later tried this approach with Nina.

questions.text: When Coach was upset, he went to the bathroom. Who was in there with him?
questions.explanation:
Carla and Diane.

	Carla was in the men's room because she was fixing the broken toilet. Diane was in the bathroom because she followed Coach to talk to him.
